title: Why is there a God according to science? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is scientific evidence of the existence of God. However, it’s not accessible to everyone, nor should it be. If you understood precisely who or what God is, or what source is, what would be the point of coming to this planet to learn or teach lessons? But the idea of God is knowable; as one spirit guide put it “God is beyond the capacity of the human brain to comprehend, it’s just not physically possible.” (“It’s a wonderful afterlife”) However, you can experience God.” So ponder this for a moment. If God is beyond the capacity of the human brain to comprehend (too much input, too many factors, too many levels of awareness) but a person can “experience God” - then that puts God into the realm of science. Because we can experience jumping into an ice cold pool of water - we can’t describe it to anyone who hasn’t done it - there aren’t enough words to adequately describe it - but we can experience it. We can’t describe unconditional love to anyone as a definition - but we can experience it. In like form, we can experience God. How does one experience God? According to this guide; “You can experience God by opening your heart to everyone and to all things.” What does that mean? Unconditional love towards everyone. Easy to say, hard to do. But beyond opening our hearts to “all people” - to all things. That tree deserves to be here as much as any human does. If you open your heart to all things, it’s going to be hard to navigate the planet. But it’s worth contemplating. Everything that exists is worthy of our unconditional love, or “opening our heart to.” How do you “open your heart?” We all know how to do it - we all know how difficult it is to do it. We choose not to. But if you want a scientific proof of what or who God is - start by opening your heart to all people and all things. Voila.

The very term 'science' and even the enterprise as played out is a mental apprehension of the physical world that cannot be understood mathematically, experimentally or with any physical thing or law. Mental substance including understanding can only be known by having a mind. I find it most ironic that . . . in an age where science continually shows the need for mental creativity in creating lifeforms and the unique computational processes in the human brain that give rise to (and aren't itself) the mind that allows man do science and even more know anything exists, science thinks the mind is just brain activity emergent from its unique neural based structure. Even ancients knew better than to make such a glaring equivocation of two basically different stuff. So science and philosophy IN DEPTH lead to God as Bacon, the father of the scientific method, rightly noted but the materialism rampant in science stops many (even some gullible religious scientists) from seeing that connection.
